body:
Comment 6 by **abdul.h.chaudhry**: 
I am not describing how to read the string. I would avoid looking at the implementation
and focus purely on correctness of the comparison. You can always scan backwards.

Anyway, In your example above

"Z" has a meaning in a specific encoding. \x00 has no meaning at the end of a string and
should be ignored or am I missing something fundamental in my understand of strings and
encodings. 

In that sense I would argue "hello\x00" and "hello" are the same in any encoding and
should be treated as being the same.
